item.title: Graffiti / Tag on cycle hangar, Irving Grove SW9, 17th October
item.description:
Graffiti /Tag was painted on to cycle hangar around midnight on Thu 9 Oct, ie, one week ago. This is the only cycle hangar on Irving Grove, on the opposite side of the road to the houses, roughly opposite number 2, Irving Grove.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Irving Grove, Stockwell, London

item.title: Bad Road Surface., 16th October
item.description:
Hello, I’m a Bis Driver and Kirkdale Rd has developed ridges in the road in both direction and it’s so bad I have to drive in the middle of the road. Otherwise my bus feels like it’s going fall apart. Anyway, please can this be looked at?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kirkdale, Forest Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: “Keep Clear”, 16th October
item.description:
Hello, I’m a Bus Driver and the ‘KEEP CLEAR’ Road Markings on the Roundabout have faded and thus it’s become difficult to merge onto the roundabout from Kirkdake Road. Therefore, please can it be repainted?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 303, Kirkdale, Forest Hill, Sydenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Puffer Crossing Green Light out., 16th October
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 18, The Village, Charlton, London

item.title: Alleyway connecting Kilburn high Road to Kilburn priory, 16th October

item.title: 49, Lennard Rd, Penge, probably - Prolific spray tag on weathered cream render brick wall pier in front garden butting the footway., 16th October
item.description:
49, Lennard Rd, Penge, probably - Prolific spray tag on weathered cream render brick wall pier in front garden butting the footway. I'm reporting this from memory and looking at Google Streetview. If it is not 49, it is an odd number 40-something very near by.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 66, Lennard Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet
